bug.summary: Step deleted in patched tensorboard log
bug.description:
When a summary is added through the patched tensorboard summary writer, the step is always removed before calling wandb.log. This results in the following warning: <denchmark-code>wandb: WARNING wandb.log called without a step keyword argument. Pass the same step that tensorboard is using to avoid data loss see: wandb: WARNING https://docs.wandb.com/docs/integrations/tensorboard.html#custom-metrics </denchmark-code>
The warning only gets printed once, so I originally thought the warning was only due to logging the graph without a step, see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/issues/571>#571</denchmark-link> , but in fact the step passed to is always ignored. I tracked down the problem to the following lines:
client/wandb/tensorboard/__init__.py
Lines 162 to 163 in b90c8a8
if "step" in kwargs:
del kwargs["step"]
Why is it like this? I don't really mind that wandb does its own step counting, but it's a bit confusing and the warning is downright misleading if this is the intended behaviour.

Our integration adds a ‚Äúglobal_step‚Äù key for each tensorboard namespace. In the UI you can choose any step you‚Äôve logged as an x-axis for your charts. We‚Äôre working on an overhaul of our metrics backend to address these issues.
